item.title: Ticket #1291 (Logged in user cannot comment on posts by other authors) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1291 (Logged in user cannot comment on posts by other authors) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description:
Oops.

In addition, I think the admin/author auto-approve check should be done prior to check_comment() and wp_blacklist_check(). We already know if the commenter will be unmoderated, and if so, we can circumvent those two other checks which would ultimately be disregarded for the commenter anyway.

Patch attached, bug1291_functions-post.diff, which incorporates kim's fix and my suggestion.

item.title: Ticket #1291 (Logged in user cannot comment on posts by other authors) updated

item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1291 (Logged in user cannot comment on posts by other authors) created
item.dc:creator: kim
item.description:
If a user is logged in, submitting a comment to a post by another author results in a crash.

Fix attached.

item.title: Ticket #1290 (Smart quotes in <pre> done by mistake) updated
item.dc:creator: Thiemo
item.description: The first patch does not work properly. I added a new one.

item.title: Ticket #1290 (Smart quotes in <pre> done by mistake) updated
item.dc:creator: Thiemo
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1290 (Smart quotes in <pre> done by mistake) created
item.dc:creator: Thiemo
item.description:
Inside of [pre], [code] and some other tags sometimes the "smart replacements" of quotes and so on are done by mistake. Try:

[pre]An "example" [strong]andstrong another "example".pre

The second quotes are replaced, the first are not. I added a fix for this.

item.title: Ticket #1289 (Not posting Custom Field data) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1289 (Not posting Custom Field data) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: I'ved tried the fix at ​http://trac.wordpress.org/changeset/2420 to resolve this with no joy. When I try and modify or publish custom field data, it works fine to setting the Key, but I cannot add or edit the Value attribute. When I *do* edit it in MySQL, I still cannot change the value via Wordpress.

item.title: Ticket #1288 (slow down cowboy...) updated
item.dc:creator: Denis de Bernardy
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #1288 (slow down cowboy...) created
item.dc:creator: Denis de Bernardy
item.description:
on my blog, I am no cowboy.

as for the spam bot, best I know is he spams thousands of sites at a time, so as to reduce his rate of spam on individual sites.

Maybe reduce the threshold to 5s rather than 15s? Based on my logs, 5s is enough to eliminate script kiddies. whereas 15-min would be more appropriate for the more clueful spammers.
